Matroska (MKV)/h.264 is the de facto standard for HD rips. VLC plays them fine on all of my machines -- Windows and Linux. Then again, it sounds like your computer with its 56k connection is a real dinosaur, so I doubt it could even handle HD playback anyway.

I'm having a problem getting narration audio.  I have the background sounds and music...but no narrator.  I am using the latest VLC...any suggestions?  Thanks.

Visually rich but fast moving, with Attenborough uncharacteristically bounding off to another subject before his usual thorough explanation of the last was even fully started.  If you are used to David Attenborough in the 'Secret Life of...' sequence of series, or can remember 'Life on Earth', where exhaustive research and thoroughness carried the day, 'Life' pales in comparison.  What this gains in HD, it loses in descriptions and explanation.  The seemingly immortal Sir David--creeping up on 90--can be forgiven for attending this production in studio only, as narrator. But I wish he had pressed some of his indisputable influence toward getting more info about life into such an ambitiously titled series as 'Life'.

That's a fair comment, burgwinkel.

Visually, this series is stunning. It is also "feels" too short or perhaps shallow.

My kids and I still love it, though. :-)
